qas.question: What position do the citizens of Estonia elect for a four year term?
What year did the Estonians create a constitutional document for their modern political system?
How many representatives are in the Estonian parliament?
What can the Estonian parliament do in regards to treaties?

context: <a0_0>The Parliament of Estonia<a0_0/> (Estonian: Riigikogu) or the legislative branch is elected by people for a four-year term by proportional representation. The Estonian political system operates under a framework laid out in the <a1_0>1992<a1_0/> constitutional document. The Estonian parliament has <a2_0>101 members<a2_0/> and influences the governing of the state primarily by determining the income and the expenses of the state (establishing taxes and adopting the budget). At the same time the parliament has the right to present statements, declarations and appeals to the people of Estonia, <a3_0>ratify and denounce international treaties<a3_0/> with other states and international organisations and decide on the Government loans.
